title: Ticket #3270: ClassAd debug() too verbose with new ClassAds
description:
NEGOTIATOR_DEBUG = D_FULLDEBUG 

$ condor_q -l | grep ^Requirements
Requirements = debug(( TARGET.Arch == "X86_64" ) && ( TARGET.OpSys == "LINUX" ) && ( TARGET.Disk >= RequestDisk ) && ( TARGET.Memory >= RequestMemory ) && ( ( TARGET.HasFileTransfer ) || ( TARGET.FileSystemDomain == MY.FileSystemDomain ) ))

And NegotiatorLog - 

2012-10-16T14:59:52-0400 Classad debug:
    [
        Requirements = true && ( ( .LEFT.JobUniverse isnt 1 || ( ( MY.CheckpointPlatform isnt undefined ) && ( ( .LEFT.LastCheckpointPlatform is MY.CheckpointPlatform ) || ( .LEFT.NumCkpts == 0 ) ) ) ) );

2012-10-16T14:59:52-0400 Classad debug: .RIGHT.Arch --> X86_64
...

The full ad is printed for each reference. This is too verbose, decreasing the utility of the debug() output.
check_ins: 2012-Oct-16 14:25   Check-in [33680]: Make debug() less verbose, skip printing CLASSAD_NODE on LHS of expression, #3270 (By Matthew Farrellee )
creator: matt
